explanation: The report is correct. The local loop variable hdr is only used to read fields (kind, header_size, header, value_size, value, next) and no writes are performed through it. According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 a pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible, so hdr should be declared as const struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *hdr (or equivalent). Changing to a pointer-to-const is safe here: reading hdr->next (a non-const pointer) can be implicitly converted to the const-qualified hdr type, and using hdr->header / hdr->value with memcpy or comparison functions still works because these accept pointers to const or the top-level const on the member does not prevent passing as a read-only source. Thus the agent A report is justified and the code violates Rule 8.13.
